item.description:
Join us on Saturday August 20th to hike two of the New Hamshire 48 4000 footers. South Kinsman is #23 at 4358 ft and North Kinsman is #28 at 4293 ft. This hike is over 11 miles with elevation gain of around 3200 feet. Please read the section below before signing up as this is a challenging hike for experienced hikers only.

 

Is This Hike for Me?

This is a lengthy hike with serious elevation gain, treacherous and steep trails, and exposure to the elements. Please have done a hike of a similar level before this one and be in good hiking condition. If you have questions about whether this hike is for you please email me.  Bring plenty of water (I'm bringing 4 liters) appropriate hiking attire (no jeans or cotton, hiking boots not sneakers), warmer layers for the higher terrain, rain gear in case the weather turns nasty, lunch, and snacks. 

 

Trailhead Directions

From Providence 3 hours 15 minutes

From Newport 3 hours 45 minutes

The trail head is at The Basin in Franconia Notch State Park. Drive up 93 north to exit 34B then drive south on 93 past the Lafayette campground to the Basin parking lot.  

Note that there are parking areas for the The Basin on both sides of 93 so you could just get off at the Basin when going north on 93 but you will then have to go through the tunnel (walking/biking only, I think) to the parking lot on the west side of 93 where the trail head is. We will meet around my car, not at the actual trail head as I have never been there and am not sure exactly where the trail head is.

 

 

Trail  Route Information (starting from the Basin-Cascades trail head)

1.0 miles on the Basin-Cascades trail

0.5 miles on the Cascade Brook trail

2.5 miles on the Kinsman Pond trail

0.6 miles on Kinsman Ridge trail to North Kinsman summit

0.9 miles on Kinsman Ridge trail to South kinsman summit

0.9 miles back to North Kinsman summit

0.6 miles to Fishin Jimmy trail

2.0 miles on Fishin Jimmy trail to Lonsome Lake Hut

1.3 miles on Cascade Brook trail

1.0 miles on Basin Cascades trail 

 

 

Carpool Option

Please use the comments section to coordinate with other hikers if you want to carpool. 

 

Lodging

I will be camping out the night before to avoid the crazy drive in the morning. I will post my campground when I get it in case any others want to camp as well.

 

Note About My Hikes

I enjoy to hike with others and meet new people...that is why I organize these events. I am, however, just that: an organizer. I have no special hiking, medical, or outdoor leadership knowledge or skills to get you through these events and you should only attend if you could accomplish the hike on your own. In most cases it is my first time doing the hike posted so my only information comes from books and web sites. Please keep this in mind when signing up for a hike.

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a grey Nissan Juke with RI plates. Cell: 508-414-8544. See directions below.
item.name: Hike the Kinsmans
